intro: Senecio sternbergianus, commonly known as the Sternberg's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that are arranged in a compact cluster, and its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive lobed shape. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in succulent gardens and rockeries.
